comments:
System: Gentoo Linux with Sun SDK 1.4.2_03

When trying to start Eclipse 3.0M6, I get a messagebox that indicates problems
during startup.

Stacktrace from .metadata/.log :

!SESSION
----------------------------------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Jan 02, 2004 22:05:41.295
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/swt/widgets/Listener
        at org.eclipse.ui.PlatformUI.createDisplay(PlatformUI.java:149)
        at
org.eclipse.ui.internal.ide.IDEApplication.run(IDEApplication.java:41)
        at
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.PlatformActivator$1.run(PlatformActivator.java:226)
        at
org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:85)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at
sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
        at
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:279)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:742)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:581)
Forgot to mention: Eclipse 2.1.1 is working without problem on this machine

In the meantime, I tried a couple of things: 
 
Running the binary download on a Debian Woody system: Same exception thrown, 
IIRC the stacktrace looked different. Sorry, I did not copy it, but if it helps 
nailing this problem down just tell me and I'll recreate it. 
 
Installed the milestone that is currently part of the distribution (3.0M6) -> 
works. 
 
Got the sourcedrop and compiled it myself -> works. 
 
It looks to me as if there are incompatibilities with the binary version for 
linux/gtk/x86 and the two Linux distributions I tried it with. Since those 
versions are not officially supported, I changed the bug severity to minor. It 
still would be nice though to find out where the problem is. Would the 
resulting binary from my compile run be of any use?
Correction: the milestone currently included with gentoo is 3.0M5
Please reopen if this problem persists in the final 3.0 release.
